creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: male figure leaning on long staff against a tree; large herd of pigs behind him
marks:
Signature, Inscription, Marks

numbered in plate monogram in plate, lower left: [HSB]
provenance: Joseph-Guillaume-Jean Camberlyn, sales in 1865 1867; apparently Adalbert von Lanna (sales 1909-11) and Posenzi collections; [Kennedy Galleries']; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Prodigal Son with the Swine
